description: Consider Fibonacci-type sequences b(0)=X, b(1)=Y, b(k)=b(k-1)+b(k-2) mod n; all are periodic; sequence gives number of distinct periods.
comments: b(k)>=k/4 (by counting zeros). - R C Johnson (bob.johnson(AT)dur.ac.uk), Nov 20 2003
links: B. Avila and T. Khovanova, Free Fibonacci Sequences, arXiv preprint arXiv:1403.4614, 2014
R. C. Johnson, Fibonacci Numbers and Resources.
crossrefs: Cf. A015135 (number of different orbit lengths of the 2-step recursion mod n), A106306 (primes that yield a simple orbit structure in 2-step recursions).
author: _Phil Carmody_
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Jan 06 2005
